title: 'Empty thoughts' and apathy: Paul D., a young man who killed five people
subhead: In December 2024, the 22-year-old killed his former boss, two former colleagues and two migrants in northern France. The following investigation revealed a life marked by several recurring traits common among mass murderers: social isolation, experiences of bullying and injustice and easy access to firearms.

title: For Putin, US operation in Venezuela is a double-edged sword
subhead: The capture of President Nicolas Maduro by the US weakens Ukraine's allies, who have positioned themselves as defenders of democracy and international law. It also deals a blow to Moscow, depriving it of a key partner and threatening its oil revenues.

title: Several femicides mark the end of 2025 in France
subhead: A man was taken in for questioning on January 1 after police discovered his partner's body in their yard in Nantes. In Lille, two femicide cases cast a shadow over the year-end holidays, reflecting a rise in the number of women killed by their partners or ex-partners.

title: In Khartoum, the faces of a martyred capital: 'War cannot kill ideas, nor love'
subhead: War in Sudan: A Trapped Nation (3/6). Le Monde's reporters traveled through the Sudanese capital, which for two years was the epicenter of the conflict. They met with residents, who recounted how they survived despite fear and violence.
